title: Is black lightning a real thing? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have not heard of black lightning outside of the DC Comics character or TV series. However, there is a phenomenon call “Dark Lightning”. In a regular thunderstorm, the process of creating regular lightning produces sprays of x-rays and gamma rays that are also ejected into the atmosphere. This is what scientists are now calling dark lightning. Here is a NASA video on the subject:  The concept was also used (in a rather hand-wavy, non-scientific fashion) in the Science Fiction TV show Manifest

Do you mean the Netflix Series, DC comic super hero or an electrical discharge? If you mean ‘is it possible to have a high energy atmospheric electrical discharge event that happens to be black’, then the answer is no. Electrical discharges, or lightening bolts cannot be black because they have to obey the laws of physics.
